alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 12:46AM EDT until May 03 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Binghamton NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...New York... Susquehanna River At Conklin affecting Broome and Susquehanna Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Susquehanna River At Conklin. * WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood stage. Alta, River and Lawrence Roads closed in the Town of Conklin due to minor flooding. No homes are flooded at this river stage. Valley park in Kirkwood takes on water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM EDT Monday the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 12.3 feet this morning. It will then fall to near flood stage this evening, and then slowly fall below flood stage late Tuesday or early Wednesday. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
